content.text: - Title: Algebra
- Course number: EP02.TOCB1101
- Type of course: Compulsory course
- Number of credits: 3 Credits
+ Theoretical hours: 27
+ Exercise and discussion hours: 18
+ Self-study hours 81
- Prerequisite: None
Department: Fundamental Mathematics
Adress: R1106, 11th flr., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam.
Lecturers:
MA. Nguyễn Thị An Email: annt@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Lê Thị Anh Email: leanhtoankt@neu.edu.vn
MA. Vũ Quỳnh Anh Email: anhvq@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Phùng Minh Đức Email: phungduc@neu.edu.vn
MA. Bùi Quốc Hoàn Email: buiquochoan@neu.edu.vn
MA. Hà Thị Minh Huệ Email: huehm@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Nguyễn Tuấn Long Email: ntlong@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Đặng Huy Ngân Email: ngandh@neu.edu.vn
MA. Phạm Văn Nghĩa Email: nghiapv@neu.edu.vn
MA. Nguyễn Thị Quý Email: quynguyen@neu.edu.vn
MA. Nguyễn Mai Quyên Email: nguyen-mai-quyen@neu.edu.vn
MA. Hoàng Văn Thắng Email: hoangthang@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Dương Việt Thông Email: thongduongviet@neu.edu.vn
MA. Phạm Anh Tuấn Email: tuanpa@neu.edu.vn
MA. Đoàn Trọng Tuyến Email: doantrongtuyen@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Tống Thành Trung Email: trungtt@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Nguyễn Thị Cẩm Vân Email: ncvantkt@neu.edu.vn

The Algebra module belongs to the General Education Knowledge block of the bachelor's degree program in Economic Mathematics, Information Technology and Computer Science. This module equips learners with basic knowledge about sets, maps, polynomials, vector spaces, quadratic forms and effective calculation tools for systems of linear equations, matrices, and determinants. The course contribute to training scientific thinking and building a mathematical foundation for application in analyzing and researching problems in the fields of economics and business. With the knowledge, skills and competencies equipped, after completing this course, learners can easily access a number of programming languages ​​such as R, Python, ... as well as the ability to study other related subjects in the training program such as Calculus 1, Calculus 2, Optimization Theory, Discrete Math.

The course consists of 6 chapters: Chapter 1 introduces the concepts and operations of sets, maps and polynomials; Chapter 2 presents vector spaces and linear relationships between vectors; Chapter 3 deals with the concepts, properties, and operations of matrices and determinants; Chapter 4 includes the contents of the system of linear equations and its applications in economics; Chapter 5 introduces linear mappings; Chapter 6 presents the basic concepts of quadratic forms and methods of identifying definite quadratic forms.
Textbook
Lê Đình Thuý, Nguyễn Quỳnh Lan (2013), Advanced Maths Textbook for Economists, National Economic University Publisher.
Others:
Nguyễn Đình Trí, Tạ Văn Đĩnh, Nguyễn Hồ Quỳnh (2008), Advanced Mathematics, Volume 1, Education Publisher.
Đoàn Quỳnh (Chủ biên) (1998), Đại số tuyến tính và hình học giải tích, NXB Đại học Quốc gia Hà Nội.
Table 5.1. Course goals

cells: The course systematically provides students with basic knowledge of sets, mappings, polynomials, vector spaces, quadratic forms, and powerful computational tools for systems of linear equations, matrices, and determinants.

column_map.Description of course goals: The course systematically provides students with basic knowledge of sets, mappings, polynomials, vector spaces, quadratic forms, and powerful computational tools for systems of linear equations, matrices, and determinants.

cells: he course guides learners with the necessary skills to competently calculate mathematical operations for vectors, matrices, and determinants; find the inverse matrix; solve systems of linear equations and apply to the analysis of some economic models; transform a quadratic form to a diagonal form and identify the definite quadratic forms

column_map.Description of course goals: he course guides learners with the necessary skills to competently calculate mathematical operations for vectors, matrices, and determinants; find the inverse matrix; solve systems of linear equations and apply to the analysis of some economic models; transform a quadratic form to a diagonal form and identify the definite quadratic forms

cells: The course equips students with some basic knowledge of economics and methods of applying basic tools of linear algebra to study, analyze and solve problems in real life as well as in economics.

column_map.Description of course goals: The course equips students with some basic knowledge of economics and methods of applying basic tools of linear algebra to study, analyze and solve problems in real life as well as in economics.

cells: The course contributes to the development of the ability to self-study, work independently, work in groups, take personal responsibility and partly responsible for the group.

column_map.Description of course goals: The course contributes to the development of the ability to self-study, work independently, work in groups, take personal responsibility and partly responsible for the group.

content.text: Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)

cells: Understand the basic concepts of sets, mappings and polynomials.

column_map.CLOs Description: Understand the basic concepts of sets, mappings and polynomials.

cells: Understand the basic concepts of vectors, vector spaces, matrices and determinants.

column_map.CLOs Description: Understand the basic concepts of vectors, vector spaces, matrices and determinants.

cells: Understand the basic concepts of systems of linear equations

column_map.CLOs Description: Understand the basic concepts of systems of linear equations

cells: Understand the basic concepts of linear mappings and quadratic forms

column_map.CLOs Description: Understand the basic concepts of linear mappings and quadratic forms

cells: Solve basic problems of sets, mappings and polynomials.

column_map.CLOs Description: Solve basic problems of sets, mappings and polynomials.

cells: Solve basic problems related to vectors, matrices and determinants such as: find the basis of a vector system, calculate determinant, perform matrix operations, find the rank of a matrix, find the inverse of an invertible matrix…

column_map.CLOs Description: Solve basic problems related to vectors, matrices and determinants such as: find the basis of a vector system, calculate determinant, perform matrix operations, find the rank of a matrix, find the inverse of an invertible matrix…

cells: Solve systems of linear equations by different methods such as Gaussian elimination method, matrix method, determinant method. Find general solutions and fundamental solutions of a system of linear equations.

column_map.CLOs Description: Solve systems of linear equations by different methods such as Gaussian elimination method, matrix method, determinant method. Find general solutions and fundamental solutions of a system of linear equations.

cells: Recognize linear mappings, find eigenvalues and eigenvectors of matrices, diagonalize matrices, use linear mapping to transform a quadratic form to the diagonal form, identify the definite quadratic forms.

column_map.CLOs Description: Recognize linear mappings, find eigenvalues and eigenvectors of matrices, diagonalize matrices, use linear mapping to transform a quadratic form to the diagonal form, identify the definite quadratic forms.

cells: Use mathematical symbols as well as identify and apply appropriate algebra concepts and techniques to model and solve common types of applied problems.

column_map.CLOs Description: Use mathematical symbols as well as identify and apply appropriate algebra concepts and techniques to model and solve common types of applied problems.

cells: Choose the correct use of quantifiable measurements of real world situations

cells: Students take exams according to the given schedule

column_map.Content: Final exam
column_map.Activities: Students take exams according to the given schedule
column_map.Assessment: According to the exam requirement

content.text: Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exams (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).

Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.

Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

full_text:
- Title: Algebra
- Course number: EP02.TOCB1101
- Type of course: Compulsory course
- Number of credits: 3 Credits
+ Theoretical hours: 27
+ Exercise and discussion hours: 18
+ Self-study hours 81
- Prerequisite: None
Department: Fundamental Mathematics
Adress: R1106, 11th flr., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam.
Lecturers:
MA. Nguyễn Thị An Email: annt@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Lê Thị Anh Email: leanhtoankt@neu.edu.vn
MA. Vũ Quỳnh Anh Email: anhvq@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Phùng Minh Đức Email: phungduc@neu.edu.vn
MA. Bùi Quốc Hoàn Email: buiquochoan@neu.edu.vn
MA. Hà Thị Minh Huệ Email: huehm@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Nguyễn Tuấn Long Email: ntlong@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Đặng Huy Ngân Email: ngandh@neu.edu.vn
MA. Phạm Văn Nghĩa Email: nghiapv@neu.edu.vn
MA. Nguyễn Thị Quý Email: quynguyen@neu.edu.vn
MA. Nguyễn Mai Quyên Email: nguyen-mai-quyen@neu.edu.vn
MA. Hoàng Văn Thắng Email: hoangthang@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Dương Việt Thông Email: thongduongviet@neu.edu.vn
MA. Phạm Anh Tuấn Email: tuanpa@neu.edu.vn
MA. Đoàn Trọng Tuyến Email: doantrongtuyen@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Tống Thành Trung Email: trungtt@neu.edu.vn
PhD. Nguyễn Thị Cẩm Vân Email: ncvantkt@neu.edu.vn
The Algebra module belongs to the General Education Knowledge block of the bachelor's degree program in Economic Mathematics, Information Technology and Computer Science. This module equips learners with basic knowledge about sets, maps, polynomials, vector spaces, quadratic forms and effective calculation tools for systems of linear equations, matrices, and determinants. The course contribute to training scientific thinking and building a mathematical foundation for application in analyzing and researching problems in the fields of economics and business. With the knowledge, skills and competencies equipped, after completing this course, learners can easily access a number of programming languages ​​such as R, Python, ... as well as the ability to study other related subjects in the training program such as Calculus 1, Calculus 2, Optimization Theory, Discrete Math.
The course consists of 6 chapters: Chapter 1 introduces the concepts and operations of sets, maps and polynomials; Chapter 2 presents vector spaces and linear relationships between vectors; Chapter 3 deals with the concepts, properties, and operations of matrices and determinants; Chapter 4 includes the contents of the system of linear equations and its applications in economics; Chapter 5 introduces linear mappings; Chapter 6 presents the basic concepts of quadratic forms and methods of identifying definite quadratic forms.
Textbook
Lê Đình Thuý, Nguyễn Quỳnh Lan (2013), Advanced Maths Textbook for Economists, National Economic University Publisher.
Others:
Nguyễn Đình Trí, Tạ Văn Đĩnh, Nguyễn Hồ Quỳnh (2008), Advanced Mathematics, Volume 1, Education Publisher.
Đoàn Quỳnh (Chủ biên) (1998), Đại số tuyến tính và hình học giải tích, NXB Đại học Quốc gia Hà Nội.
Table 5.1. Course goals
Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)
Table 7.1. Course assesment
Table 8.1. Lesson plan for the course
Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exams (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
